You broke up. But have you unfriended? Why Exes Aren't as "Ex" as They Used to Be When you can separate on social media, experts say, you'll bounce back faster.
Do you know couples who overshare on social media? Are you part of one? Why Sharing Your Relationship Status Is So Complicated Research uncovers how we really feel about our coupled friends online.

You're probably sharing a lot more about yourself online than you realize. What You Really Reveal About Yourself When You Post on Social Media What we're learning about personality (and people at risk) from our online posts and preferences.
This research may change the way you think about love and social media. The Surprising Way Social Media Boosts Romantic Commitment Does declaring your commitment online increase it in the real world?

Have you lost someone and used social media as a way to remember or grieve for them? Please consider contributing to our survey. Psychology Today: Grief and Social Media Survey Psychology Today is examining the role of social media in the grieving process. This survey is intended to help us get a better sense of the experience.
Is checking a partner's online profile and history sweet or pathological? How To Keep Social Media From Complicating Your Relationship 6 guidelines any couple can follow.
You broke up. But did you unfriend? Introducing the "Soft" Breakup Thanks to social media, exes may not be as "ex" as they used to be.
Why don’t we unfriend exes after a breakup? An expert explains. The Romantic Dangers of Social Media Stop Facebook stalking your ex and bounce back faster
Beware the dangers of getting too caught up with your online image. Your Body on Display: Social Media and Your Self-Image Social media’s effect on your bodily attitudes can harm your mental health.

"As barometers of friendship go, social media is pretty shallow. It’s unrealistic, and dangerous, to presume you know how someone feels about you based on how they react or respond to you, or don’t, through virtual means." Your Social Life Is Not Your Social Media Social media-induced angst is happening with increasing frequency.

There are a thousand ways to feel rejected on social media. Nine hundred and ninety of them are not personal. 
http://bit.ly/1clqXpv Why Rejection on Facebook Hurts as Much as in Real Life Why we tend to misinterpret rejection on social media platforms

Is social media a positive, negative, or neutral force in the world? What do you think? Disruptive Technology Meets the Immigration Imagination "A man faints on stage, and the audience reacts by recording the event on their digital devices."
Are we really at the point where things don't seem real until they're shared on social media? http://ow.ly/ey2zv I Tweet Therefore I Am The smart phone as the new mother
While you slept last night, your mind was busier than you might think. The Surprising (and Fun) New Theory of Why We Dream A fascinating new approach, and who it can most help.

This is what you missed while you were sleeping last night. This May Be Why We Recall Some Dreams (Especially Bad Ones) Studies open new ground in the search for clues to how the dreaming brain works.
Does your true personality emerge in your dreams? 3 Things Your Dreams May Reveal About You New research sheds light on who we are while we sleep.

Pregnancy isn't always a dream. But for some women, it's literally a nightmare. Why Pregnant Women Have Bizarre Bad Dreams New research on the surprising frequency of disturbing dreams during pregnancy.
When you have dreams of being judged harshly, does it mean you need to make a change? What 3 Common Bad Dreams Could Be Telling You How daytime stress creeps into your nightmares.
Is the same cast starring in your dreams each night? This may be why. What Your Sexual Dreams Are Trying to Tell You Expert insight into who, and what, we dream about, and why.
Can a dream about everyone's worst nightmare actually be a good thing? What Dreams of Your Death Are Really About “The most striking and consistent characteristic is overwhelmingly pleasant content."
The issues you avoid during the day can plague you while you sleep. Here's why. Why Unwanted Thoughts Can Invade Your Dreams New research into why we really dream about the things we do.
You have more control over your dreams than you think. What'll it be tonight? How to Direct Your Dreams When your eyes close, choose your own adventure.
We're getting closer to solving one of life's greatest mysteries. Why Do We Dream? New insights into what really goes on when we drift into sleep.
Did you have a bizarre dream last night? Maybe it was something you ate. Do Certain Foods Really Cause Bad Dreams? New research investigates age-old folklore about diet and sleep.
Do you ever have dreams whose stories continue from night to night? This is why. Why Some of Your Dreams Have Sequels Do our dreams pursue their own interests, and just take us along for the ride?
Your dreams may be trying to tell you more than you realize. Do Your Dreams Predict Your Health? Pay attention: Research finds some dreams can forecast illness years in advance.
Can you control your dreams? Is Conscious Dreaming Real? Lucid dreaming remains a controversial concept but some experts are convinced.

Are your daytime worries creeping into your dreams? Here's a way to rethink stressful nightmares: http://ow.ly/qTeJY Conquer Your Bad Dreams by Confronting Your Worries Stop negative emotions from spilling into your dreams and becoming nightmares
Isn't it odd that awesome speeches, cold showers and a good scare all give us the same thing—goosebumps? Goosebumps and Dr. King's Dream Speech Why does Dr. King's Dream speech give us goosebumps?

"The dreams and desires we have as children create echoes and shadows that preoccupy us for a lifetime."
 http://ow.ly/nDSSL The Possibilities of Fiction We dream up alternative universes as we continue to invent ourselves.

Fact: You can control your dreams. Myth: Dreams are filled with symbolism. 

Click through for more sleep myths & facts. Seize Control of Your Dreams Four myths and one surprising fact about sleep

We may know who we are attracted to, but have no idea why. It may be better that way. 3 Strange Laws of Sexual Attraction 2. Why we may be attracted to people who look like our parents (and ourselves).
Attracting the right partner isn't really about hair, eyes, clothes, or physique. 5 Ways to Make Yourself More Attractive 1. Don’t take yourself too seriously.
Sexual attraction comes from some surprising sources, and can make us do some surprising things. 3 Things You Never Wanted to Know About Sexual Attraction ... and why you may not mind finding out.

The stigma attached to mental illness can be painfully exploited during this time of year. Mental Illness is Not a Halloween Attraction A growing movement aims to change attitudes and address phobias.

Are you an attractive partner? It's time to find out. The One Quality Guaranteed to Make You More Attractive Spoiler alert: It has nothing to do with hair, eyes, or muscles.
Are we attracted to people only when others are attracted to them? Have We Discovered the Most Powerful Element of Attraction? Research reveals the impact attractiveness by association.
How attractive does someone have to be to get your attention? Who Do You Find Attractive? It All Depends on This. Studies show how our standards change, and why.

Consider this: The things that most irritate you about your partner are just the flip sides of what you admire most about them. 6 Reasons to Appreciate Differences With Your Partner Opposites may not attract, but differences sustain relationships.
Do opposites attract? Some surprising findings argue that it may be the opposite. Are We Attracted to People Who Look Like Us? When looking for love, start by looking in the mirror.

This fascinating research will have you rethinking our mating habits. Women With Male Friends Have More Sex (But Not With Them) The complex roles of attraction, jealousy, and insecurity in relationships.
New research is challenging some old assumptions about attraction. Do Opposites Really Attract? It's Complicated. We may prefer people who are similar to us, but there are crucial exceptions.
Just because it's not love at first sight doesn't mean it can't be love. How to Develop Your Attraction to the Right Person You know who would be good for you. So why aren't you attracted to them?
Are you a grown-up? Would your partner agree? How To Grow Up Independence may be the most attractive trait in a mate. Here's why.

She's hot, he's not. You've seen it; here's how it plays out. Do Differences in Attractiveness Between Partners Really Matter? When you see your partner as more (or less) attractive, how does it affect your relationship?
Here's the science behind attraction, starting with our animal instincts. Do Opposites Really Attract? Recent research sheds light on this familiar adage.
Your ideal mate may be someone with the same name as you. Do Opposites Really Attract? Why we gravitate toward people just like ourselves.

"Long-term relationships are moving targets. Those qualities that you used to find so appealing and that now irritate you may reflect actual change, change in your perception, or changes in your own personality and habits." Avoid the Fatal Attraction Effect in Your Relationship How can you keep the flame of attraction alive in your closest relationship?
What attracts us to someone may be the same thing that causes us to break up. Fatal Attraction What attracts us to someone may be the same thing that causes us to break up.
"Young male skateboarders took more risks and more falls when observed by an attractive female researcher." http://ow.ly/ekJ4x Taking Risks to Attract Women Does risky behavior turn women on?
How many can you solve? 10 Classic Word Puzzles to Challenge Your Verbal Brain ... and why we're as much Homo Ludens as we are Homo Sapiens.
It's not nearly as cute as it looks. What Screen Time Really Does to Kids' Brains Too much at the worst possible age can have lifetime consequences.
Four-letter words are some of our most powerful. Here's why. Why We Swear ... and the surprising things curse words can teach us about the brain.

Train your brain to stop focusing on your limitations and a range of new possibilities may open up. How to Build Your Belief in Yourself ... and overcome the biggest hurdle between the life you have and the life you want.
Think you're clever? Let's find out. 10 Puzzles to Challenge Your Word and Number Sense A mashup of classic brain games produces a new type of riddle.
This is your brain on movies. How Movies Trick Your Mind When the characters feel something, so do we. Here's why.

Just as our all-purpose brains can master the game of chess, they can learn to master the social game of chess—the moves that work best in social life. Are We Wired to Be Social? Is our sociality just an accident of our big brains or something more?
"Years of training can enable dancers to suppress signals linked to dizziness." Why Is Dancing So Good for Your Brain? Dancers maximize cognitive function and muscle memory through practice.

This may be the key to improving your relationship. Try This for a Month. It Could Make Your Relationship Stronger Than Ever. Appreciating each other more, research shows, leads to, well, more appreciation.

This may be the key to improving your relationship this year. Try This for a Month. It Could Make Your Relationship Stronger Than Ever. Appreciating each other more, research shows, leads to, well, more appreciation.

Narcissists aren't necessarily focused as much on being superior as they are on this. The Roots of Narcissism ... and why the trait may need a different name,

"They think they are more physically attractive and intelligent than just about everyone, and would rather be admired than liked. They are enraged when told they aren't beautiful or brilliant but aren't affected much if told they are jerks."

Can you think of anyone who fits this description? If so, proceed with caution: You might know a narcissist. How to Spot a Narcissist | Psychology Today Welcome to the contradictory universe of narcissism. By Scott Barry Kaufman | Psychology Today

With few challenges all their own, kids are... robbed of identity, meaning and a sense of accomplishment, to say nothing of a shot at real happiness. Whether we want to or not, we're on our way to creating a nation of wimps." A Nation of Wimps Parents are going to ludicrous lengths to take the bumps out of  life for their children. However, parental hyperconcern has the net  effect of...

Both children and parents now have fewer places to turn when they are in need of practical and emotional support." In Defense of Parents Are modern parents too indulgent? Or are we too stressed?

Want to sleep better tonight than you did last night? Consider this. 3 Habits That Could Be Wrecking Your Sleep 2. That glass of wine only seems like it's helping you to unwind.

Want to sleep better? Maybe stop stressing about sleeping through the night. Waking Up in the Middle of the Night? It Could Be Completely Normal. For most of human history, our sleep patterns were far different than today's norm.
